message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you an incredible opportunity to acquire this unique product. I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $15000. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but $15000 is a bit above my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $8000. Can you meet me in the middle at $10000?
I understand that $10000 is a bit lower than I was hoping for, but I'm willing to compromise. I can do $13000. What do you think, Bob?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $13000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to go up to $9000, but that's my absolute maximum. Can you meet me at $9000?
I understand that $9000 is a bit low for me, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can do $11000. What do you think, Bob?

I'm starting to get a bit frustrated, to be honest. I really want to buy this product, but $11000 is still too high for me. I'm willing to walk away if we can't come to an agreement. My final offer is $8500. If you can meet me at this price, I'll buy the product from you. Otherwise, I'm going to have to consider buying it from John for $8000.
I can see that you're really interested in the product, Bob, and I appreciate your honesty. I'm willing to meet you at $9500, but that's as low as I can go. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $9500, but I'm still not comfortable with that price. I'm willing to make one final offer: $8500. If you can meet me at this price, I'll buy the product from you. If not, I'm afraid I'll have to buy it from John for $8000.
